intro: Suttonia kauaiensis var. petiolata, commonly known as the Kauai petioled suttonia, is a rare endemic plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive leaf structure, featuring elongated petioles that support its broad, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within the native forests of Kauai. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species.
